alert.note: Alert for Coastal Georgetown; Coastal Horry (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued October 14 at 3:25AM EDT until October 14 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TO 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Up to one half foot of inundation above ground level expected in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...In North Carolina, Coastal Brunswick County. In South Carolina, Coastal Horry and Coastal Georgetown Counties. * WHEN...From 7 AM to 10 AM EDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Vulnerable causeways to and from local beaches may experience minor coastal flooding. Low-lying roads and locations along the Intracoastal Waterway and adjacent tidal creeks may observe minor coastal flooding. Check with local officials for the latest information regarding coastal flood impacts and closures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Affected areas listed are based on average tide conditions. Additional locations may experience flooding during periods of heavy rainfall, high winds, or other factors. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Springmaid Pier at Myrtle Beach MLLW Categories - Minor 7.0 ft, Moderate 8.5 ft, Major 10.5 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.4 ft, Moderate 2.9 ft, Major 4.9 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 14/08 AM 7.1 1.5 1.3 3 Minor 14/08 PM 6.3 0.7 0.8 3 None 15/08 AM 6.7 1.1 0.8 2 None 15/09 PM 6.4 0.8 1.1 1 None 16/09 AM 7.2 1.6 1.2 1 Minor 16/09 PM 6.3 0.7 1.1 1 None Mercer Pier at Wrightsville Beach MLLW Categories - Minor 6.0 ft, Moderate 8.0 ft, Major 10.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.5 ft, Moderate 3.5 ft, Major 5.5 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 14/08 AM 5.9 1.4 1.1 3-4 None 14/07 PM 5.1 0.6 0.8 3-4 None 15/08 AM 5.6 1.1 0.7 2-3 None 15/08 PM 5.4 0.9 1.1 2 None 16/09 AM 6.2 1.7 1.2 2 Minor 16/09 PM 5.3 0.8 1.1 2 None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
